review: Look, you go to Chili's for a strong margarita and typical bar food. This place was fine, clean and the server was attentive.  We sat in the bar area, and it was a great place to watch a game and drink. I'd go back if nothing else than for the Margaritas.
we went there with some friends late one evening and  had a blast! The guacamole with pineapple was extra tasty. They always have good specials.and our server was extra attentive.

Visited 6/11/12 with 2 friends. I had a burger (tad bit overdone) with a side of fries and avocado but they remembered my whole wheat bun and sauteed onions. My friends had the appetizer trio and fajitas; everyone was satisfied and said they would get the same meal again. Bathroom and dining area clean and one guy was sweeping nonstop. The only problem: the DNA issue. I cringe when I see servers or bartenders doing anything that might get their DNA in my food or drinks. If I managed any food establishment I would aways ask them to never eat or drink in clear view of customers or touch your face/hair while serving them. Wash hands frequently. Anyway, the problem was the bartender who was sweating profusely. He pulled up the bottom of his shirt, wiped his face and kept right on working...yuck! Luckily we were not interested in alcohol.
Had the sirloin.  This is one of the best Chili's I've ever been to.  Service was 7 out of 10, food was 7 1/2.  All together a pleasent experience--I will come back.

My family eats at Chili's in our town regularly. We usually order the custom combos or the dinner for two. Unfortunately we were a bit disappointed with the food. The steaks my daughter and I ordered were over-grilled despite asking for medium-rare. My wife's margarita chicken was also dry. Nonetheless, our waitress was courteous and pleasant. We'll probably go to the Viet place next time.
Food a bit too salty but my steak cook perfectly. Really good service, never have to ask for more refill. 4.5 star for service but 3.5 for food.

This Chili's was pretty good!  We visited on a Monday night and it was fairly busy. We ordered a 2/$20 with chips and salsa.  Soon after we got the appetizer, the entrees showed up.  The staff were friendly.  We paid using the new table boxes where you swipe your card.
Friendly bartenders. Pretty good food for the price, especially on the 2 for $20 menu. We would not recommend the Colada 'Rita. It's just too many different liquor flavors.

On the plus side, service was outstanding.  Amy was my server in the lounge area and she could not have been more friendly and attentive, checking just frequently enough to see if I needed anything.  On the down side, Chili's new taco pizza was one of the worst things I've had in a restaurant in some time -- underseasoned ground beef and globs of congealed cheese on a soggy crust.  There's no Tex-Mex flavor to warrant the name "taco" in the title.  Should have stuck with the tried-and-true Southern Smokehouse burger.  (And, speaking as someone who wanted to get some work done while I ate, I wish this Chili's joined the wave of chain restaurants with available wi-fi.)

Restaurant is busy with lots of cars and great buzz of activity that is very representative of the community.  Food is very fresh.  Parking is abundant--great if you have a vehicle that is hard to back-up.    Recommend the following dishes: salmon, rice and broccoli, sweet potato fries, and Caribbean Salad.  Service could be a little bit faster.   I really like the Ziosk console because it is very convenient and fast for settling the check.  Would recommend a back or ESC key on the games which cost $2.  Ordering function on the console did not work.  Good for a work in progress though.  Fries could be a little more crisp.  Bathrooms are well maintained.  Otherwise, overall a good dining experience.

After a long day doing the tourist thing in DC, we stopped here for something small.  We had appetizers.  They were good.  The waiter seemed a little slow as if he just started.  Overall it was a nice place to go to and would go back.

I got about five $25 gift cards for Chilis from my American Express benefits.  Needless to say we have eaten there allot lately!   The Monday night fajita special for 2 for $16.99 plus $2 more for beans and rice is a great value!   This location is new and the staff has always been super.  Would highly recommend this location!

Not bad. After an unpleasant experience at my local Chili's in Florida, I was hesitant to go here but my parents seem to be fans and suggested we come here for some fajitas and quesadillas (you know, the staples) while I was home visiting. Server was nice, food was fine, etc. I appreciated that he gave us the 2/$20 deal on the more expensive entrees on the list, and the kept the cheaper ones separate. Our only complaint was that the tables and menus were super dirty and covered in food- but our server was more than happy to clean them for us after we sat down. For such a busy place full of kids and families, this Chilis's does a good job managing the crowd and getting food out quickly. I would go back next time I'm home.

Never ever again! I went here and sat at the bar. I ordered wings and while I was eating I saw a roach crawling across the bar. Super gross and freaked me out. I told the manager and he offered me more wings. Uhhh no thanks sir. No roach wings for me. I left after that and I will never ever return!!!!

By far the worst Chilli's I been too, got the appetizer wrong, got my wife's order wrong. Her beans were cold, meat was under cooked, the manager came out to tell us that medium cooked meat has a slight pink in the middle, though my wife's meat was bloody, not medium. . . more like medium rare.

I know I know, chain restaurants....but sometimes you just need some pre-packaged sysco food to get you through the day...right???   The service here is fast and friendly and the place is always relatively busy which is a good sign.  We got the 2 for $20 deal.  Started with the chips and salsa.  Crispy thin warm chips are perfect, but we've always thought the salsa was just a bit too watery and runny (surely intentional to minimize consumption).  The original chicken crispers are very good with a nice beer batter crust, well seasoned fries, and nicely buttered corn on the cob.  The chicken fajitas tasted good, but I always have a problem with the amount of accoutrement that accompanies them.  There is enough meat, peppers and onions to make three tortillas worth, but you get about 1 teaspoon of cheese, 1 teaspoon of iceburg lettuce, and a teeny dollup of pico.  The drinks were refilled rapidly and our check came quickly.  While not the definition of fine dining, it does the job.
This is a great place. I always sit at the bar area and the service is normally great. The last time the young lady was a little unresponsive but the other times were great. I'm definitely going back

I loved it first time I went there they had nice burgers and we order chilli cheese and appetizer dish  And I back with my wife the very next week but the quality was different and the food didn't teat tje same (I ordered exactly the same as firat time)   And I said to give them another chance and I wwnt there for the third time . But this time it was even worse . And also my wife agreed that every time the food was different .  I don't know if I'm going to go again but if I go I wish its going to be like my first visit
Food is between ok and good. Service is good . But interior appears to be rundown and food smells quite strong inside.

My 14 year old daughter wanted to go here for her early birthday "dinner out" and chose Chili's.  We went with the rest of the family including her grandfather.  That's five of us.  They had no problem seating us immediately however.  The server was pleasant and although it took awhile to get our simple drink order once we got them she made sure we all had refills when needed.  The food was fresh tasting and I particularly liked my meal which was the Shrimp Tacos.  I loved the flavor and spiciness.   My daughter got the steak and shrimp combo meal with mashed potatoes and broccoli.  She enjoyed it except for the broccoli which was over cooked but we didn't tell the server.  We ordered two deserts; Chocolate Molten Cake and Cinnamon Cake.  Both were very good and a nice way for five of us to end the meal.   My daughter was very pleased and thought it was great.

Food wasn't great tonight and we come at least 4 times a month. A few members of the staff set in a both behind us Friday May 30th making all kinds of noises and using horrible language. If they didn't need the help send them home or tone it down. Maybe we should have gone to Fridays.
Chili's is always a great place to go. The restaurant is clean, the food is fantastic, and  the staff is always friendly and has a smile. My favorite place to go :)
It's been almost an hour since I placed my order in an almost empty restaurant and I'm still waiting. Unbelievable. Worst service that I have ever experienced in a Chili's.
The service was ok and the food was average. My wife and I prefer the Chili's in Kingstown better. The Food is much better there.

Four stars might be generous but went to the Fridays across the street first and had to leave so this was leaps and bounds better! According to my group of six... Pros: 10 minute wait on Saturday night The ribs The loaded fries  Jumbo oretzel sticks Received food in a reasonable time Reasonable prices Good service  Cons: The mozzarella sticks were the worst I have ever had Strawberry lemonade Dirty A large group sat next to us and the servers moved tables together for them. They were pushed right up next to us and were very loud and it was like we were practically sitting together Who takes their little kids out to dinner at 1030pm?? So all in all I doubt I would neccessary jump on the idea to go back but if it was this chilis or the Fridays across the street I will be at chilis seven days a week

We came here for dinner with a group of family members the other night. The parking was great (always something I can appreciate living in DC). We were seated quickly, greeted nicely by our server, and the overall experience was great. I'd expect nothing else from Chili's. My order was (slightly) wrong, but it was nothing to complain to them about. It was a mix up on sides, but that happens. Two thumbs up!

First visit to this particular location and I'll definitely be back.  Arrived with the boyfriend at an odd time, 3:45 in the afternoon.  No, we're not 80 and looking for the Early Bird Special, we just stayed up late the night before and slept in :D  We were greeted quickly and seated, our server introduced herself and got our drink order within 2 minutes.  Cathy (Kathy?) was a wonderful server, on top of everything from the moment we arrived until we were ready to leave. We ordered the Texas Cheese Fries (full order) to share, and the timing between the serving of them and the serving of our entrees was perfect.  Boyfriend had the steak & chicken fajitas, I had the Southwest Pairings combo (trio)--3 choices for $10.49.  Ordered the chicken enchilada with sour cream sauce, the beef enchilada with red chile sauce and the beef crispy taco. Everything was great.  Taco was crispy and full of meat, both enchiladas and sauces were great, food was hot, rice and beans were tasty.  Boyfriend demolished his fajitas and took his rice and beans to go. Didn't have any issues with the table being dirty or the place being loud, possibly since it was between lunch and dinner, but for a first visit it was very nice and we will likely return.

I have NEVER had a good experience at this location. Unless it was in the bar. The bar tenders are helpful and caring. The rest of the staff and the food are just terrible. Pick another location--- Manchester Lakes was 5 stars for sure!!! Just having to walk through the "smoking section" to get into either door is a bit concerning to me.

I was at the Chili's this evening in Kingstowne and sat at the bar since all I wanted was the triple dipper and to my surprise the server was the same as last time and I knew she was slow and not attentive at all but oh well I gave her another chance...nope it took forever for her to serve me...she is not server material at all.  Her name is Jessica.  I won't ever be back!

Some of the best wings around. They used to serve 10 on the dish. Now they only server 8. Besides that...I still love their wings! They are half price during happy hour too...so it's a great dinner with a few beers. I've been going there since they opened maybe 7 years ago...highly recommend the wings. Thanks Chili's!

If you like Chilis this is a great location. The waitstaff is friendly and prompt. I can only speak for the burgers and wings which were perfect! The burger was juicy and tender with all the right toppings. I will go back to this location again. :)

Damn it!  This place is the doorway to Hell!  So nasty you wouldn't want to go there to save your life!  Dirty bar area; I ask, when was the last time anyone cleaned this place?   Spike TV:  Please call Jon Taffer - because this place needs a serious Bar Rescue!!!

I don't believe there is anything bad I can think of from my few visits to this Chili's. Their pizza and flatbread are so tasty, and the skillet chocolate chip cookie is devine. I really want to get the soft pretzel sticks again, too, because those were amazing! The service was nice, and I shall hopefully be back someday soon.

Nice when they first opened, not so nice now. Dirty restaurant, odd staff, food is hit and miss. Regular cast of unsavory characters that you'd expect to find loaded on a Tuesday night at other high end establishments on route 1 such as the Outback and The Quality "bed bug" Inn. Don't sit at the bar, trust me. Go to the Chilli's in Manchester Lakes, much nicer.
YUCK!! big disappointment... Never again... Costumer service off and food tasted out of a can a frozen box and cardboard...

I LOVE LOVE LOVE Chilis, I go to this location all the time. I mean I get the same thing, the $20 or $35 dollar special which you get an appetizer, 2 entrees with the $20 and the $35 you get 2 margaritas, appetizer, 2 entrees and dessert. I normally get the honey chipotle chicken crisper entree and the brownie sunday for my dessert. I can't really speak on the other food that is served because I rarely order anything different but the location is nice. I normally sit in the bar area and the waiters are all always very nice and never get my order wrong. When I first started coming here the place was empty but over the past couple of years business has picked up and there is usually a line, normally there is always space in the bar area so you don't have to wait in line. It's a good place to watch the game as well. So if you are looking to go somewhere along the same line as Fridays then Chilis is where it is at.
Typical Chili's. We had very good and prompt service. Had a southwest grilled chicken salad which was good. Similar to other Chili's/franchise type of restaurants. Will go again.

I went to this Chili's on 5/28/15 for dinner.  I don't go to Chili's that often. I find it humorous every time I go it looks like they've created a new menu but it always the same stuff with new pictures.  I've never had a problem with the food at this Chili's but to be fair I don't go to a Chili's expecting a fine dining experience (and to be fair their price point doesn't reflect that either). Chili's is doing a "new" thing and having you place your refills and pay for your meal from a computer screen directly placed on your table. I think. The service at this location is reflecting this change. Although the service wasn't bad it wasn't exceptionally either (but again to be fair if I worked here I would not hustle for my tip because of how they have the computers at the tables set up).  In a nutshell quality food at a quality price but if you're feeling like having something special or frankly healthy Chili's might not be your best option.

A few friends and I met up at Chili's for some quick lunch.  A national chain, this restaurant serves up various appetizers, lunch combos, fajitas, dinner options, and desserts.  It seems as if there were more combo specials added to the menu and a tablet-ordering system that is installed at every table (that we didn't use).  From the appetizers section, I had the 'Triple Dipper' - this allows you to choose 3 from a selection of appetizers, which actually was quite filling; I tried their newly-added Crispy Cheddar Bites (overcooked/overfried, as they were were supposed to be little nuggets of fried cheese, topped with Cajun seasoning); Fried Pickles (these were not crispy at all, but more on the 'chewier'/soggy end); and, Big Mouth Bites (2 mini sliders with fried onion and cheese; the bread was slightly stale, and it was better with some ketchup). I liked how the platter came with 3 different sauces, though (in which one contained 2 of the Crispy Cheddar Bites already taking a dip :P! We also shared a couple of the Molten Chocolate Cake, which looked like a mini volcano of chocolate cake, topped with vanilla ice cream (that was covered with a thin chocolate shell), drizzled with fudge - this was pretty delicious, as the cake itself was very moist, and the ratio of the ice cream to the cake was pretty good.  Our server was Kathy, who was very nice.  However, during the lunch rush, the kitchen does get backed up, so we did wait for some time in receiving our orders.  In addition, we had to wait a while to get a check, because our server went a little MIA at the end.  I am not sure if I'd come back to this location, as there is a TGI Friday's up Route 1 that serves fresher food.   +tablet-ordering system at each table +lunch/appetizer deals +Molten Chocolate Cake +HH +MIA service

I had a shard of a broken plate in my sandwich. They did not seem to give it much thought when I mentioned it but at least they took my sandwich off the bill. The buffalo chicken ranch sandwich isn't bad though, as long as you nibble around the sharp pointy shards of broken stuff.

This was my first time at a Chili's and the food was pretty darn delicious. My sister and I bother ordered the bacon burger, a side of fries, and appetizer of onion rings. Everything was delicious and our food was nice and hot! Fried perfectly seasoned and the ranch dressing that was served with the onion rings had such good flavor. I ended up dipping everything in it. I would def visit again.

Look It's Chili's, shouldn't expect service, food and ambience of a hipster trendy place. We didn't expect much but since we live a few blocks over we thought we would give it a try. To my surprise it was great! They renovated the whole place to look more modern and bright. The bar area with several large screens is a great place for me to escape during football season. The service is as good as it gets for a chain. The food, now mind you I'm a foodie, was surprisingly good. The Fajitas here is comparable to Austin Grill - sans rice and beans (which I never touch anyways). I'm giving it a 4 for making the skeptic a believer and surprise factor.

My fiancé and I eat here often. The food is consistently good and the service can be up and down, but mostly it's been very good. Our server tonight, Amanda, has been the best so far! She's genuine and attentive. We will continue to come back.

We ordered food few minutes ago for lunch meeting the bill was pretty high. None of the fajitas came with rice and beans so we called thinking they made a mistake the manager gets on the phone and said no rice and beans don't come with it when we ate there last week it did. No one orders was correct. We won't be going here again. The general manager called us back catered the whole lunch and everything tasted excellent
I Currently have been waiting 15 minutes from when i ordered my drink to get it, The waiter is mopping the floor instead of getting it !! It does not take 15 minutes to pour a lemonade.

No good service from our waiter but the manager was on point. Right from the front door we were greeted with smiles and a friendly atmosphere from the hostess but once we were seated our waiter just had a look on his face like he was their to pick up a tip and pay check. Our server only showed up to take our order and serve our food. The manager noticed that we weren't happy with the greasy chips and changed them. We saw the manager more times than we saw our server. All the other servers had a smiles on their faces and we're moving like crazy. Our server was the only guy and was the only one without a smile. But the manager made the service all the better. Thank you manager. This rating should have been a one star but seeing you serve us as you did your job and helped others gave this rating a 3. Plus I noticed that everyone else had a better server and ours was the only one not in sight unless we were getting our food, check, or to clean our table.
Pretty good for the price. Excellent service! Clean and organized. Friendly staff. Go there...you will be glad you did!
Smoked smothered chicken burrito was delicious. Service was impatient and disappointing.
Food was great but this goes to the horrible bartender. Heavier set caucasian young lady, very rude and charged an  extra drink. Was rude about it afterwards.

Two words: happy hour. $2.50 domestic drafts and half off appetizers. Decent service, especially at the bar (a little slower in the bar area.) Look, this is a Chili's and there's not much to say. But for a Chili's, this is great. Tell me where else other than my house we can get beers and enough appetizers to serve as dinner with a $20 tab. If we were cooler, we'd prefer the more unique local (pricey) places from our old DC neighborhood, but as it is, this is a nice, comforting slice of suburb life.

Can I give zero stars? This establishment's only redeeming quality is it's free wifi. Otherwise, everything is pretty dismal. My wife and I were sat by a busboy, waited 15 minutes for a server who never came then went inside and waited 5 minutes at the bar before we were helped. The bartender ignored us and cleaned the bar (she walked by twice), and our server made our drinks. We ordered Coronarita Margaritas that were all triple sec (was there tequila in there? Maybe...). Way to go, Chilis! You managed to fail to exceed my already low expectations. I'm glad our gift card is out now so we don't have to come back! Big props to our waitress who felt like working tonight. Big thumbs down to everyone else here.

So, I had not been here for a long time, but wanted the Queasadia Explosion salad. Not as good as I remembered,  but not horrible. What was horrible is the Santa Fe salad my friend had. They left in the plastic wrap from the "grilled" chicken breast. When they replaced it, there was no dressing on the salad at all. The kicker, the salad price was still on the bill. Won't be back anytime soon.

So, we almost did not stop because of the negative reviews. We have had great service, courtesy of  Chika. She has taken great care of us and even made "Southern sweet tea" for my guys. Glad we took the chance and came regardless of the negative reviews. Service comes from your server and we had a great one. Wanting great service, just ask to sit in her section.  Chika took great care of us!!!

Update: I did hear from Chili's expressing concern about my experience. They wanted me to know that they took my experience seriously and was going to investigate the situation. I am glad to hear that they took it seriously. They also told me that they were sending down my experience to the regional manager and he will be getting back with me.  The reason I still gave them a star is because I should not have been put into this situation to begin with. If people would just do there jobs.

Actually here right now. Walked in and no hostess to be seen so we sat in the bar. Once we got our food no server to be found. Ordered a dessert with the online system nothing in 20 min. Asked where dessert was and they said it was being defrosted???? All the staff at the bar just talking and on their phone. Honestly the worst service sever. Still waiting for dessert!!!! Now it's been almost 30 min.

We enjoy this restaurant.  There is an "endless salad" you can order at lunch.  You can have all the soup and salad you want.  I call ahead to see what soup flavors are being served, to determine if we are going to visit.  Hubby likes the chili.  Bonus points for letting adults color too.

Never never ordering from here. I decided to do take out. I ordered the carnitas tacos , most of the meat was burnt to a crisp! Beef jerky is easier to bite than this meat!  I put all the hard pieces to show the amount of meat that was not edible. I got a refund.

Ok, it's a chain. I know how could I review this puppy, but it really isn't all that bad. The bar has a nice TV setup, which strategical placed TV so that you can rule the fantasy football world like a John Madden mastermind.  Oh, and if football isn't your thing, you can have a humongous margarita in a Fred Flintstone size glass. But for me, it was all about the Spinach Queso dip, a bit of cheesy goodness that made me glad that I stopped in

Food was decent. The service is where this restaurant lacks stars. I had to interject and ask for someone to take our drink order and our food order twice. The waiter was too busy talking to a table next to us that he seemed to know.  Management here needs to get involved (they were already having to go around and apologize) and get their staff in line!

It seems like everything Chili's serves comes frozen and the cooks in the kitchen just heat it up and bring it to your table. The fajitas for instance, have a sizzle but does not come out smoking like most fajitas. It's because they don't cook it there. They just reheat it and send it to your table. The french fries were soggy. We asked for more and for them to make them crispy. The fresh french fries were more golden, but still not crunchy. The customer service was spot on. It seems like this place employees a lot of teenagers, which I think is great.  All in all, it's decent food, with great customer service.

Upon entering the establishment, the main floor of the location's interior is much larger in size and scale as opposed to it's exterior. Now upon my arrival, I took notice to the fact that I was the only individual within the premises. I was promptly seated in a rather clean booth. The seats, had a very pleasing amount of filling  within them as a pleasant change. Soon after being seated, my waitress promptly tended to me. When my drink arrived, I greatly enjoyed the fact that it came served within a beer mug. I rather enjoyed this  as the beverage I requested was non-alcoholic as alcohol would affect my better judgment as an expert food critic . In addition, the mug was also clean and tidy. Almost immediately after depleting the liquid contained within my mug, it was almost immediately replaced by the very kind and attentive waitress. My appetizer arrived at the same time as my new drink, and it was freshly prepared and very pleasing as far as portion is concerned.  Upon venturing out to the men's facility, I took notice to the view of the kitchen, which is an interesting atmospheric choice. Upon entering the facility, I noticed it was incredibly clean and organized, and smelled divine. I must also comment that it is very professional how the waitress will check and assure things are going accordingly within the table.  Upon receiving my entre, it was beautifully masterfully prepared. It was also tastefully sound.

Mixed feelings on this one, the food was EXCELLENT no complaints there, the server was friendly but not constant, our drinks did not get refilled until we had to gooseneck for 20 minutes.  We had an accidental drink spill and all the servers and managers walked by us noticing with no intent to help, once again had to gooseneck for at least some napkins... and before leaving we had a final neck stretch trying to find our server. Great food, mediocre service.

Yusef the cashie/waiter at the carryout is exceptional.  He explained the bill to me and made sure I checked the food so I had everything. He is personable and knowledgeable. Yusef is a great asset to Chili's!!! He made the checkout a great experience!

The absolute worst place in the area if you are looking for a real dining experience with real food. The food is substandard bulk boxed food that is instant ready made just add water and microwave. It is served lukewarm to cold, tasteless and unappealing by servers who all appear to hate their jobs.  Management is horrible and host is sloppy and inattentive while loudly bashing neighboring restaurants. This place is worst than a dive. If you're just looking to get drunk and don't care about service or how good the food is  this is your place. This restaurant needs to close asap! There are much better choices in this area that will serve you good hot food without waiting an hour after placing your order.  This restaurant is also filthy!!! Time for the health department to come and do a random check.  I realize it's a chain restaurant in a poorer section of town, but come on, you really need to do better or disappear! YUCK!

DISGUSTING! Terrible customer service. Walked in wasn't greeted by anybody, had to seat myself and no employee acknowledged me at all. Waited about 10 mins couldn't find a manager then Sara appeared but acted like she didn't want to be there  or talk. After explaining this she tried to make excuses for her employee and "offered" me an appetizer for my troubles. Atmosphere was not exciting was very dull. Me and my wife will never come to chilis because of this horrific experience save yourself the time and don't come here.
Don't eat here if you have food allegies they don't listen and almost sent me to ER twice

I was there on Memorial Day and the service was horrible, the girl at the front greeted me with a mad face and a bad attitude, then the server was ok, but never offered drink refills and I had to ask for napkins. Food took a while to be served while the restaurant was not even half full, food wasn't great either. It seems like they were very unhappy working on a holiday.  My family and I love chili's and prior experiences at this location were not bad, but after this time we don't want to come back.

I was completely screwed over by management and their lack of organization. I have no choice but to contact Human Resources about the matter.  I have never been treated so poorly at a job in my entire life. This is very upsetting because I thought this would have been a great place to work. They also never paid me wich is illegal and hr refused to do anything about it

Well.  Ordered the 2 for $22 meal and waited 20 minutes for our food.  No drink refills or additional salsa during the wait and no waitress came by.  Wife's food was normal Chilis good, but the  chicken pasta was cold.  Took another 5 minutes to get the waitress attention to let them know.  Waited another 10 minutes and food came back just a little warmer but still cold.  Another 10 minutes we get the bill and we now being  charged full entre price for my wife's meal.  Asked for a manger and lowered the bill.

Just... not... worth... it. Something should have told me to go elsewhere - when the hostess came out in a grey dirty polo shirt from the day before, wearing crocs- and never cracked a smile.  So, we came in for lunch anyway, and they did not have many people there. Waitress takes awhile to arrive... but again... almost with an attitude. We place our order, but it takes nearly an hour for appetizer to arrive. Table-side guacamole is just sliced avocados dropped at the table with other stuff, but without any care or service. We have to make it ourselves. They should really call it "Do it yourself Guacamole".  Other food finally comes, and is marginally prepared. "Grilled shrimp" are frozen microwave mini-cocktail prawns. The kind they put in cheap salads. Orders are not complete. Things are off. No offers of drink refills. Had to flag down waitress for everything. Not even a napkin! Food: Poor Service: Poor Atmosphere: Marginal Don't bother... just no worth the time.

Nice atmosphere, drinks are so BOMB!! I had the blueberry, pineapple margarita, Long Island ice tea, and some kind of black cherry margarita ALL of them were BOMB!! Sat in there for about 3 1/2 hours that how relaxing it was. This is a nice spot to chill.

Sent back a margarita because it had hair and black stuff floating in it. The same margarita got sent back to me a second time. I sent it back again and asked why the same drink even made it back to a table period. They sent out a third margarita that still had specks floating in it. I requested to I did not want to receive another thing from their bar. Food was not up to the usual Chili's standards we have received at other locations... we decided after this experience and the recent menu changed we will no longer patronize this chain.

Hands down the worst chili's I've ever been to. We ordered to pick up. After asking the bartender to please have someone come out to help us, Bc take out is unmanned, they gave us our food.  Not only was the food cold but wrong. The ultimate bacon cheeseburger was thrown... literally thrown in the box... no fries, condiments or pickle. The smoky wings were undercooked, the quesadillas were so cold the cheese solidified. We took the food back, again having to wait to be helped. The waitress said, 'Well it wasn't me... I just got here. I guess I should have checked your order though.' I said I don't care. I want it fixed. After waiting for them to redo my order, it came back worse. I just walked out as the waitress screamed she was sorry.  Don't go to this location. While I waited for my good another lady came in to have her food redone. And btw, the kitchen needs to turn down the music, it's unbelievably unprofessional.

Stay away from here. This is piece of crap. I and my wife got here 9 pm to get something to eat. We had to wait almost 20 minutes to get drink ordered. Ironically, there weren't so many customers at that time. Some waiters and waitress were just wandering around and cleaning tables. The food finally took around 40 minutes to get to our table. I mean it was just some Thursday nite!!! It was ridiculous.

Two words....VERY slow. About 730pm  on a Thursday. Took about 5 minutes for hostess to greet us so there was folks just standing in the doorway. There were several empty tables and the hostess said "just give us a chance to get caught up, it will be 15 min". I later saw her cleaning tables. There were several clean, empty tables when we came in so I'm not sure how they were so behind....maybe they were short staffed. Once we were finally seated...it was over an hour before we got our order which consisted of 3 burger meals,  2 appetizers and one desert. What was more upsetting than waiting a total of at least 1.5hrs was the table next to us came in about five min after us but got their ribs, steaks and full hearty meals before we received any part of our order. They even ordered additional food as they were eating and got that food before we received any part of our meal. There were six of them, all teenagers and it was obvious they were friends with the waiter. So we sat there listening to a bunch of teenagers cuss and talk nonsense for an entire hr before I had enough and told my friend let's walk out but my friend was so mad and hungry after driving 7hrs that she asked to speak to the manager. I decided to give 3 stars because while we waited forever to get the little food we ordered...the manager was pleasant and apologized when my friend spoke to her, and said our ticket would be on the house....the waitress while pleasant, never came back to ask if we wanted our drinks refilled nor did she offer any explanation for why we were still waiting and she also failed to  ask us if we wanted anything else....in which we actually wanted desert for the kids and another drink. We were aggravated and upset but spoke to the manager with respect and she was understanding of our frustrations. The food was hot and it was good. Overall, I won't return...I can't see waiting 1.5 for a burger and desert again. Kudos to the manager though, she handled the situation by taking responsibility and she even made sure we got our food.
